medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began approximately 6 days before admission with a large stool surrounded by clotted blood. This was followed by 4 days of intermittent fevers and irritability. Symptoms included decreased oral intake without emesis and developed a mild cough the day before admission.
medical_history.past_medical_history: The patient had a previous emergency department visit at 6.25 months of age for vomiting and abdominal pain, but had no known chronic illnesses or surgeries.
medical_history.family_history: Maternal grandfather had colon cancer; paternal aunt died at 20 from cancer associated with an abdominal cyst. No family history of inflammatory bowel disease.
medical_history.social_history: The patient lived with parents, a sibling, and other relatives.
